title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, pleaded not guilty to murder and kidnapping charges involving his sister Michelle Knox's death in Lynn District Court.
Smith allegedly made statements about killing Knox prior to police responding at Newhall Street, according to The Boston Globe.
Smith has prior charges, including a guilty plea to assault with a dangerous weapon; case details remain impounded by the court.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks and highlighted defensive potential despite a 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Landry, a key free-agent signing, contributed heavily to New England's seven total pressures against QB Geno Smith.
Despite defensive strengths, the Patriots allowed 362 passing yards, with Raiders achieving nine 20+ yard plays.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots struggled in the season opener, losing 20-13 to the Raiders at Gillette Stadium.
David Andrews highlighted the run game's ineffectiveness as the most disappointing aspect of the loss.
New England managed only 60 rushing yards, with no carries for Stevenson and Henderson in the second half.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm will run his first Bruins training camp on September 17, focusing on intensity and accountability.
Sturm aims to improve the Bruins' defense and power play, building on last season's 33-39-10 record.
Sturm is known for direct communication, drawing from his experience with coach Darryl Sutter, to encourage player development.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Worcester girl testifies against Joshua Hubert for his alleged 2017 kidnapping and attempted murder.
Hubert, a family friend, allegedly kidnapped and threw the girl off a bridge into Lake Quinsigamond.
Trial delayed since 2020; prosecution and defense both presented opening statements on Monday.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, a touchdown, and an interception in Patriots' 20-13 loss to Raiders.
Maye denied needing a lighter workload, stating NFL quarterbacks naturally have extensive responsibilities regardless of team.
Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, reflecting tensions with Patriots since leaving in January 2024.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookies Will Campbell and Jared Wilson started on the left side of the offensive line against Drake Maye.
Right tackle Morgan Moses advised Campbell after his tough debut, noting challenges faced in the first NFL game.
The Patriots struggled offensively, scoring just 13 points and allowing four sacks, including two involving Campbell.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte, once a top prospect compared to Stefon Diggs, was picked by the Patriots in the sixth round in 2023.
Boutte's college career at LSU was impacted by an ankle injury, limiting his playing time and impacting his draft prospects.
Boutte has emerged as a key player for the Patriots, with a strong season opener performance and praise from coaches and teammates.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters from Rhode Island to Boston's Seaport at 400 Summer St.
Approximately 700 Hasbro employees will move from Rhode Island to Boston by the end of 2026.
The company's new headquarters will occupy 265,000 square feet in a WS Development-owned building.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu leads mayoral race by 50 points, with 72% support compared to opponent Josh Kraft's 22%.
Wu's support has grown from a 30-point lead in July and a 13-point lead in February, according to Emerson College polls.
Boston's preliminary election aims to narrow candidates for Nov. 4 general election, with Wu and Kraft expected to advance.
